subject: Avoid port delete race conditions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 11:28:36.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/hyperv_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Avoid port delete race conditions

We are attempting to unbind a port when receiving port delete events
or RPC calls. This is prone to race conditions, as the according
methods are not synchronized.

For this reason, we get ValueErrors when attempting to update the
cached information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/523766/

While this seems harmless (besides polluting the log), it's safer
if we just put proper locks in place.

Change-Id: I854d04618eb9eabc4cee170bd21e98317ec15678
Closes-Bug: #1596916
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid port delete race conditions

We are attempting to unbind a port when receiving port delete events
or RPC calls. This is prone to race conditions, as the according
methods are not synchronized.

For this reason, we get ValueErrors when attempting to update the
cached information: http://paste.openstack.org/show/523766/

While this seems harmless (besides polluting the log), it's safer
if we just put proper locks in place.

Change-Id: I854d04618eb9eabc4cee170bd21e98317ec15678
Closes-Bug: #1596916

Instead of using assertFalse(A * B) / assertTrue(A * B),
developers should use assertEqual/NotEqual/Less/LessEqual
/Greater/GreaterEqual/In/NotIn/IsNone/IsNotNone
The * operator: '==', '!=', '<', '<=', '>', '>='

Change-Id: I11b60a93c089f688c6b243da01d20c205c4f2df9
"}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual/Less/Greater/In/IsNone

Instead of using assertFalse(A * B) / assertTrue(A * B),
developers should use assertEqual/NotEqual/Less/LessEqual
/Greater/GreaterEqual/In/NotIn/IsNone/IsNotNone
The * operator: '==', '!=', '<', '<=', '>', '>='

Change-Id: I11b60a93c089f688c6b243da01d20c205c4f2df9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-20 22:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/admin/test_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Change addCleanup create_tenant to delete_tenant, fix gate

Tempest patch with Change-Id of:
I3fe7b6b7f81a0b20888b2c70a717065e4b43674f

Changed the v2 Keystone tenant API create_tenant to keyword
arguments. This broke our API tests that used create_tenant
with a tenant_id... It looks like the addCleanup that was supposed
to delete the newly created tenant actually created a second
tenant. The existing create_tenant calls were unaffected
by the Tempest change as it is backwards compatible.

Change-Id: Ie82c16ebf8dde988d68a01fc8dfa073085af4728
Closes-Bug: #1594593
'}]
commit_message:
Change addCleanup create_tenant to delete_tenant, fix gate

Tempest patch with Change-Id of:
I3fe7b6b7f81a0b20888b2c70a717065e4b43674f

Changed the v2 Keystone tenant API create_tenant to keyword
arguments. This broke our API tests that used create_tenant
with a tenant_id... It looks like the addCleanup that was supposed
to delete the newly created tenant actually created a second
tenant. The existing create_tenant calls were unaffected
by the Tempest change as it is backwards compatible.

Change-Id: Ie82c16ebf8dde988d68a01fc8dfa073085af4728
Closes-Bug: #1594593

commit_message:
Stub for TrunkPlugin and for the notification driver

This is a stub for the trunk service plugin and the notification
driver. The plugin will take care of performing the DB operation
for trunk and subports and to notify the L2 agent using the
notification driver.

Change-Id: I2f6f32f759121e66a9957e7671925a90590ed725
Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-01 22:00:17.000000000', 'files': ['java/src/test/java/monasca/api/app/command/CreateNotificationMethodTest.java', 'monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_notification_methods.py', 'java/src/main/java/monasca/api/app/validation/NotificationMethodValidation.java'], 'message': "Allow TLD test with port in Notification Webhook Address

To allow notification webhooks to access the Top Level Domain (TLD) of test,
the validation of Webhook addresses was changed to allow urls of the form
http://test.test.  However, the validation incorrectly rejects urls with
a port, for example, http://test.test:4343

Changed the regular expression to handle the optional port. I think the
UrlValidator should have stripped it off before presenting it to
the validator, but it doesn't so the regular expression has to handle the
port

Added tempest test to verify API works with a TLD of test with and without
port

Change-Id: Ie95b4ec3c13f3f6b54aab390e234227bc81d8be9
Closes-bug: 1597070
"}]
commit_message:
Allow TLD test with port in Notification Webhook Address

To allow notification webhooks to access the Top Level Domain (TLD) of test,
the validation of Webhook addresses was changed to allow urls of the form
http://test.test.  However, the validation incorrectly rejects urls with
a port, for example, http://test.test:4343

Changed the regular expression to handle the optional port. I think the
UrlValidator should have stripped it off before presenting it to
the validator, but it doesn't so the regular expression has to handle the
port

Added tempest test to verify API works with a TLD of test with and without
port

Change-Id: Ie95b4ec3c13f3f6b54aab390e234227bc81d8be9
Closes-bug: 1597070

commit_message:
First documentation for Operational tools

This patch is a first documentation for deploying Operational tools in
TripleO.

That's a start of work and expect more content in the future, but that's
the basic structure of what we need to deploy the stack.

It includes Monitoring & Logging content for both undercloud &
overcloud.

Co-Authored-By: Swapnil Kulkarni <me@coolsvap.net>
Change-Id: I9326a46de121ba6591babe632355b78557741d4d

incompatible.  This method just adds an action resource on the load balancer

DocImpact: Adds new API resource to delete a load balancer and its children

Change-Id: I9556d78620971fd47b7834d5ff534b9c159d14fb
Co-Authored-By: German Eichberger <german.eichberger@hp.com>
Closes-bug: #1521783

commit_message:
Adds Cascade option for load balancer drivers

Alternative approach to cascade deleting a load balancer through the API.
The original method was to override the normal load balancer delete and use
the cascade delete if the driver supported it.  This was backwards
incompatible.  This method just adds an action resource on the load balancer
that when called will cascade delete the load balancer.

DocImpact: Adds new API resource to delete a load balancer and its children
           in one API request.

Change-Id: I9556d78620971fd47b7834d5ff534b9c159d14fb
Co-Authored-By: German Eichberger <german.eichberger@hp.com>
Closes-bug: #1521783

commit_message:
Implement a --timeout for killing stalled scripts

This implements the feature required for bug #1595722 but the tripleo
bug is not closed until os-refresh-config is invoked with an
appropriate --timeout value.

commit_message:
Functional test which executes os-refresh-config

This provides functional test coverage for executing
os_refresh_config.py as a separate process.

dib-utils is added as a dependency since os-refresh-config depends on
dib-run-parts being available.

Related-Bug: #1595722

commit_message:
Supports the Docker "expose" option

The Docker "expose" option allows that a port-range and protocol
be specified through the "docker run" command:
  docker run --net=my_kuryr_net --expose=1234-1238/udp -it ubuntu
This patch set implements this feature by using Neutron security
groups.

Closed-Bug: #1569142
Change-Id: Ib7e1fd4de66a7bf69d59a3bd711994b935270b66

commit_message:
Tri-state checkbox widget

Tri-state checkbox is the kind of checkbox which has three states
instead of two, as the regular checkbox has.

Third state is "indeterminate", which means, that that element is in
undefined state. Common example of such situation is some parent
element, which has some of child elements selected and some not - and
so it means that parent element is not selected nor unselect - which
in terminology of this changeset called "indeterminate" state.

Partially implements bp assign-category-button Depends-On:
Ie65a77eab29aa191420fbd630b1d242b59c9ff9f Change-Id:
I98116fce362af5eb4c64941f4c442dd81120e762

Change-Id: I9ea151b47d2a942184517526a9c1a9127224aa04

'}]
commit_message:
Incorrect success message of remove routers with firewall in Horizon

while updating firewall, success message is displayed like
"Router(s) was successfully removed from firewall fw." even when
no routers were actually selected to remove.

So, modified the code such that below exception is raised when there
is no change of parameters compared to the existing data in database
"Error: Failed to update firewall FW: Invalid input - No firewall
parameters were updated"

Change-Id: I8adc35f9c7b56caff87822775ad2fa1030c264c2
Closes-Bug: #1513396

This patch adds the field extra_dhcp_opts to networks and subnets
so that it is possible to define the DHCP options applied to ports
at different levels, simplifying the configuration for scenarios where
every port in a subnet or network should have common DHCP options.
To provide this functionality additional models have been added for the
networks and subnets to store the DHCP options, and the DNSMasq driver
for the DHCP Agent has been updated to understand the new fields.

DocImpact: Document new extra_dhcp_opts fields for Subnet and Network
Change-Id: If0dbeb58f3b88f06e89e54e73dc14f13f20c6b80
Partial-Bug: #1512666
Implements: blueprint dhcp-options-per-subnet
'}]
commit_message:
Enhanced Network/Subnet DHCP Options

This patch adds the field extra_dhcp_opts to networks and subnets
so that it is possible to define the DHCP options applied to ports
at different levels, simplifying the configuration for scenarios where
every port in a subnet or network should have common DHCP options.
To provide this functionality additional models have been added for the
networks and subnets to store the DHCP options, and the DNSMasq driver
for the DHCP Agent has been updated to understand the new fields.

DocImpact: Document new extra_dhcp_opts fields for Subnet and Network
Change-Id: If0dbeb58f3b88f06e89e54e73dc14f13f20c6b80
Partial-Bug: #1512666
Implements: blueprint dhcp-options-per-subnet

commit_message:
Allow unknown hosts to be served by neutron dhcp

This patch adds a new field, dhcp_allow_unknown_hosts to the Subnet model
so that it is possible to enable unknown devices to be served by the
neutron dnsmasq instance.

Change-Id: Ic00f451112c69662a9e33318c3ce31f1a6776d99
Closes-Bug: #1512666

commit_message:
vm migration needs persistent state for l2pop

VM Migrations trigger update_port_postcommit calls.
Such calls would land up on different api workers in
an environment
where multiple api_workers are configured for neutron
server.  In such situations, in-memory object references
maintained inside l2pop mechdriver instance of an
api_worker, is not visible to other mechdriver instances
in other api threads.  This results in vm migrations not
handling tunnel cleanup correctly, resulting in
accumulation of tunnels on nodes. So the fix persists
l2pop migrated port state in DB, so the state is visible
to all api/rpc_workers.

Change-Id: Ia6e9f1615c9baead44a6ae0880563504c18774fe
Closes-Bug: #1443421

commit_message:
[WIP] OpenFlow based IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Responder

Couldn't sleep. Started thinking about if I could use the OpenFlow
protocol and the Nicira extensions to Open vSwitch to generate Neighbor
Advertisements for known IPv6 addresses so that we can cut down
on broadcast traffic transmitted over expensive VXLAN tunnels.

To be honest this is my first time playing around with this kind of
stuff in OpenFlow so I doubt that I've got it right.

TOOD: Unit tests, functional tests, packet dumps, and lots of poking
with tcpdump to make sure we are actually generating Neighbor
Advertisement packets that actually make sense.

Related-Bug: #1532338

Change-Id: Ie92552aa962b7cf23ecf925ceaf3794f652ca567

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-18 13:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py'], 'message': 'Can not reload dnsmasq after update dhcp port

Currently, when call add_network_to_dhcp_agent() method,
if dhcp_port is None, create_dhcp_port() method would be called
to create a new dhcp port. But this method does nothing to put
the new port into cache. So when update the new port, a NoneType
error would be raised, finally the dnsmasq would not be reloaded.

Generally speaking, the dhcp port would be putted into cache
correctly, and dnsmasq would be reloaded successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1546462

Change-Id: I786c3bdf628317d70c65e05970222524282b58ed
'}]
commit_message:
Can not reload dnsmasq after update dhcp port

Currently, when call add_network_to_dhcp_agent() method,
if dhcp_port is None, create_dhcp_port() method would be called
to create a new dhcp port. But this method does nothing to put
the new port into cache. So when update the new port, a NoneType
error would be raised, finally the dnsmasq would not be reloaded.

Generally speaking, the dhcp port would be putted into cache
correctly, and dnsmasq would be reloaded successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1546462

Change-Id: I786c3bdf628317d70c65e05970222524282b58ed

commit_message:
Fix subnet update to no-gateway without l3 check

port of network:router_interface exists even if the subnet updated to
no-gateway

This patch add ckeck and router interface delete process:
when update subnet --no-gateway:
 * check and router interface delete
 * delete or update gateway port
 * nofity subnet update

Change-Id: Ifffe40f4d436ed5e88f6b2036a248cdef7598a46
Closes-Bug: #1554837

commit_message:
Consolidate the OVS DF and CSUM options into constants

The 'dont_fragment' and 'tunnel_csum' options are present in both
the agent configuration, as well as being optional keyword args to a
method in ovs_lib. Since they are the same options with the same values,
let's not repeat ourselves.

Change-Id: I566e1159027d262c56f7cea6423f1dcb3ca6bd53

commit_message:
[WIP] Deprecate the tunnel_csum option for OVS in favor of autodetection

Mailing list thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086083.html

We should try and do some self discovery to see if we have a new enough
kernel and new enough Open vSwitch that we can enable this option.

The performance improvements are very compelling.

http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/dev/2015-August/059335.html

"We found that enabling UDP checksums for vxlan triggers GRO on the
receiver, and boosts the vxlan performance to 8+ Gbps."

Change-Id: I9f790962502919a7fb604c881b963d9d24135030

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-09 10:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/namespaces.py'], 'message': "Configure IPv6 on HA router only if IPv6 is enabled

L3 agent should check if IPv6 is disabled on the system
and create HA router namespace with IPv6 disabled.

This is required especially in case of L3 HA because,
Neigbhor discovery and Multicast listener report results
in physical switch re-learn the MAC address of the
external port, and place it on a port that's looking at
a standby and not at the master.
This causes 100% packet loss for any incoming traffic
that should be going through the master instance of the
router.

Also in environment where IPv6 is disabled, this behavior
of L3 agent results in IPv6 packets in the network.

This patch introduces a check in L3 agent to create HA
router namespace with IPv6 disabled if IPv6 addressing
is disabled on the system.

Closes-Bug: #1551065

Change-Id: I2fe20cac59237dc0980f51608f1ffbcb68f51d50
"}]
commit_message:
Configure IPv6 on HA router only if IPv6 is enabled

L3 agent should check if IPv6 is disabled on the system
and create HA router namespace with IPv6 disabled.

This is required especially in case of L3 HA because,
Neigbhor discovery and Multicast listener report results
in physical switch re-learn the MAC address of the
external port, and place it on a port that's looking at
a standby and not at the master.
This causes 100% packet loss for any incoming traffic
that should be going through the master instance of the
router.

Also in environment where IPv6 is disabled, this behavior
of L3 agent results in IPv6 packets in the network.

This patch introduces a check in L3 agent to create HA
router namespace with IPv6 disabled if IPv6 addressing
is disabled on the system.

Closes-Bug: #1551065

Change-Id: I2fe20cac59237dc0980f51608f1ffbcb68f51d50

[{'number': 28, 'created': '2016-02-29 08:16:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py', 'etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/l3.filters', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_legacy_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/legacy_router.py', 'neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py'], 'message': "Remove floatingip addresses from router device

Current code will try to add floating IP address to external gateway
device in centralized router namespace. It's a convenient way to do
proxy arp for centralized router. But for DVR router, specially the
DVR local router, it inherits the same way to configure floating IP
address, so it will cause issue in [1]. Traffic sent to a floating
IP which happens to map to a fixed ip on the same network should go
through the routers default SNAT. In DVR, this means routing the traffic
through the centralized SNAT part of the router. The problem is that
since the IP address is configured on the router's device, it thinks
it owns the address and will not route it through.

The solution is fixing previous SNAT iptable rules and removing
floating IP addresses from router_2_fip device in DVR local router
namespace. The needed-by patch[2] will work on that.

But that will mean the DVR router would handle floating IPs inconsistently
with non-DVR routers. Since the only reason to add the address to the
router's interface is for proxy arp, we can instead configure arp proxy
in all cases to be consistent.

[1] a VM ping another VM on the same host with the later one's
floating IP address, but get replied by the later one's fixed
IP address. https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1462154
[2] remove floating IP address from DVR router device
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246894/

UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored-By: stephen-ma <stephen.ma@hpe.com>
Partial-Bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ie47126e010876400f5a9a6e661e4d3709bfc10dd
"}]
commit_message:
Remove floatingip addresses from router device

Current code will try to add floating IP address to external gateway
device in centralized router namespace. It's a convenient way to do
proxy arp for centralized router. But for DVR router, specially the
DVR local router, it inherits the same way to configure floating IP
address, so it will cause issue in [1]. Traffic sent to a floating
IP which happens to map to a fixed ip on the same network should go
through the routers default SNAT. In DVR, this means routing the traffic
through the centralized SNAT part of the router. The problem is that
since the IP address is configured on the router's device, it thinks
it owns the address and will not route it through.

The solution is fixing previous SNAT iptable rules and removing
floating IP addresses from router_2_fip device in DVR local router
namespace. The needed-by patch[2] will work on that.

But that will mean the DVR router would handle floating IPs inconsistently
with non-DVR routers. Since the only reason to add the address to the
router's interface is for proxy arp, we can instead configure arp proxy
in all cases to be consistent.

[1] a VM ping another VM on the same host with the later one's
floating IP address, but get replied by the later one's fixed
IP address. https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1462154
[2] remove floating IP address from DVR router device
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246894/

UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored-By: stephen-ma <stephen.ma@hpe.com>
Partial-Bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ie47126e010876400f5a9a6e661e4d3709bfc10dd

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-02-29 08:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py'], 'message': "Optimize _get_dvr_sync_data for floatingip

Previous processing in _get_dvr_sync_data will do host filter
for floatingip(in python logic, not by DB query), and for that
its processing seems unnecessary, for:
* when agent is in 'dvr' mode, it should only return floatingips
  hosted by given agent/host.
* when agent is not in 'dvr' mode, it should return:
  * all floatingips when router is not DVR router;
  * only floatingips hosted by given agent/host when router is
    DVR router.

When above logic can be done in DB query, we can save those
unnecessary processing for floatingip. And this is the point
this patch try to optimize _get_dvr_sync_data.

Closes-Bug: #1533313
Change-Id: Ifec8c58436228ba54635025b59a49b5916bdf444
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize _get_dvr_sync_data for floatingip

Previous processing in _get_dvr_sync_data will do host filter
for floatingip(in python logic, not by DB query), and for that
its processing seems unnecessary, for:
* when agent is in 'dvr' mode, it should only return floatingips
  hosted by given agent/host.
* when agent is not in 'dvr' mode, it should return:
  * all floatingips when router is not DVR router;
  * only floatingips hosted by given agent/host when router is
    DVR router.

When above logic can be done in DB query, we can save those
unnecessary processing for floatingip. And this is the point
this patch try to optimize _get_dvr_sync_data.

Closes-Bug: #1533313
Change-Id: Ifec8c58436228ba54635025b59a49b5916bdf444

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 02:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py'], 'message': 'Fix TestDvrRouter for dual_stack router dict

In TestDvrRouter, method _add_snat_port_info_to_router and
_add_fip_agent_gw_port_info_to_router will add fip agent gateway port
info and snat port info to router dict, per info in external gateway
port info and internal ports info in router dict.

When a router dict is created with dual_stack set to True, its external
gateway port will two subnets and two fixed_ips, and each of its
internal ports will also have two subnets and two fixed_ips, one for
IPv4 and another for IPv6.

But currently, these two methods will only process the first subnet and
fixed_ip for router dict, which make dual_stack fail to work.

This patch will fix the problem mentioned above, and make sure all
subnets and fixed_ips in router dict get been processed.

Closes-Bug: #1552070
Change-Id: I07b93c96942bd1577abe1a882c7931b58c542cc8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TestDvrRouter for dual_stack router dict

In TestDvrRouter, method _add_snat_port_info_to_router and
_add_fip_agent_gw_port_info_to_router will add fip agent gateway port
info and snat port info to router dict, per info in external gateway
port info and internal ports info in router dict.

When a router dict is created with dual_stack set to True, its external
gateway port will two subnets and two fixed_ips, and each of its
internal ports will also have two subnets and two fixed_ips, one for
IPv4 and another for IPv6.

But currently, these two methods will only process the first subnet and
fixed_ip for router dict, which make dual_stack fail to work.

This patch will fix the problem mentioned above, and make sure all
subnets and fixed_ips in router dict get been processed.

Closes-Bug: #1552070
Change-Id: I07b93c96942bd1577abe1a882c7931b58c542cc8

commit_message:
DVR: Remove fip netns default gw after subnet update

Currently, after external subnet updates with --no-gateway parameter,
DVR fip netns related that external network will still keep the
stale old default gateway. It should delete the stale default gateway,
since external subnet is set no gateway now.

This patch will fix that, make stale default gateway be deleted in
fip netns after external subnet updated to no gateway.

Closes-Bug: #1551596
Change-Id: Idd4dd055e96e8b312000325ce1057909768746ab

commit_message:
Adds support to provide udpcsum option for Linux Bridge

The new option for the linux bridge agent will enable to
set/unset the udpcsum option for the vxlan tunnels.
This enables GRO on the receiver with some network card.
The default is maintained as False.

This feature requires kernel 3.16+[1] and iproute2 3.18.0+[2]

[1] http://kernelnewbies.org/Linux_3.16
[2] http://lists.openwall.net/netdev/2014/11/07/103

DocImpact: Add udpcsum option to enable GRO on the receiver
Change-Id: Ice9584ef9ad2a8df4dac303b5a6b63e398526463
Closes-bug:  #1515069
Related-Bug: #1492111
Signed-off-by: Takashi Okamoto <okamoto_takashi_p3@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Make keepalived add_vip idempotent

L3 agent operations are designed to be idempotent to be resiliant
in the face of missed notifications, out of order notifications
processing and agent restarts. One exception is keepalived's
add_vip that was made to explicitly barf when the agent tries
to add a vip that was already inserted to keepalive'd internal
cache. This was done in patch 142630 by my request to root
out bugs. Well, we found such a bug and in retrospect may not
have been the smartest idea.

Change-Id: Iead975787e2847828286d7b644dcbe33cf57ace9
Related-Bug: #1523999
(cherry picked from commit eb84048bbc27d6743016da9beeda071ccb92cd9c)

commit_message:
WIP: Adds consumers executor_type

When creating consumers, an executor_type can be specified
to oslo_messaging, which specifies which kind of executor
to use when handling messages.

Accepted values are: eventlet, threading, blocking.

Neutron will create eventlet consumers by default.

Change-Id: Ib7d2fbea3265e6665e5f0267658aa2d88061c864

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 16:59:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/coordinator.py', 'neutron/services/l3_router/l3_router_plugin.py', 'neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'POC: Use DLM for locking L3's scheduler

The existing code that exists for the l3 scheduler is extremely raceful
since multiple workers (initiated from both RPC and API) can call this
code. One option to deal with these races is sending numerous patches
that check these races and if found - fix them. The other option is
using a DLM (Distributed Locking Mechanism).

Thankfully, OpenStack already has a DLM library called tooz, and this
patch introduces it to Neutron.

This patch exists mainly to show that "it can be done" and that it's
quite easy. There are multiple details to look into here, including:
1. Which backend do we want? (I chose redis because ceilometer uses it
   but a few more are available, including etcd, consul, ZooKeeper...)
   Also, need to add devstack support for whichever one we use
2. Do we want to use a ring-based synchronization method? A centralized
   managing entity? A consensus-based algorithm? If so, how many to
   establish a consensus?
3. How often do we want to update that we're up? (I used a hard-coded
   10 but we probably want it to be configurable)
4. ...?

Closes-Bug: #1552680
Change-Id: Id019e55ddb9d030220be961a474aea30a583d334
'}]
commit_message:
POC: Use DLM for locking L3's scheduler

The existing code that exists for the l3 scheduler is extremely raceful
since multiple workers (initiated from both RPC and API) can call this
code. One option to deal with these races is sending numerous patches
that check these races and if found - fix them. The other option is
using a DLM (Distributed Locking Mechanism).

Thankfully, OpenStack already has a DLM library called tooz, and this
patch introduces it to Neutron.

This patch exists mainly to show that "it can be done" and that it's
quite easy. There are multiple details to look into here, including:
1. Which backend do we want? (I chose redis because ceilometer uses it
   but a few more are available, including etcd, consul, ZooKeeper...)
   Also, need to add devstack support for whichever one we use
2. Do we want to use a ring-based synchronization method? A centralized
   managing entity? A consensus-based algorithm? If so, how many to
   establish a consensus?
3. How often do we want to update that we're up? (I used a hard-coded
   10 but we probably want it to be configurable)
4. ...?

Closes-Bug: #1552680
Change-Id: Id019e55ddb9d030220be961a474aea30a583d334

commit_message:
WIP: add extend quota left api in quota show

We can send rest request like:
xxx/quotas/[tenant_id]?left=True[&query_type=[network,subnet,router,rbac_policies]]
to query the current quota left of specified tenant. This patch add the
logic code and tests.

Change-Id: I27def3e35d80f9aefd00cf1b5faf2a5317250068

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-04-07 21:09:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/common/utils.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py'], 'message': "Avoid multiple gw ports on the same router WIP

WIP: just a base for discussion

A port can be manually created by assigning the device owner as
--device_owner='network:router_gateway' to a router that already has a
default gateway for the same network. This causes the router to have two
default gateways for the same network.

This patch disallows to create directly gateway ports or to transform
ports into gateway ports. Router gateway has to be set by updating
'external_gateway_info'. This is done through specific validators for
internal/external port create/update.

UpgradeImpact:
   Port creation and update does not work with the
  --device_owner='network:router_gateway' option.
DocImpact:
  This new restriction to the port create/update operation
  should be updated in the API docs and CLI command manuals.
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I22a5ee1b17f37130bed35d6d4a25dfa1186c11da
Closes-Bug: #1430345
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid multiple gw ports on the same router WIP

WIP: just a base for discussion

A port can be manually created by assigning the device owner as
--device_owner='network:router_gateway' to a router that already has a
default gateway for the same network. This causes the router to have two
default gateways for the same network.

This patch disallows to create directly gateway ports or to transform
ports into gateway ports. Router gateway has to be set by updating
'external_gateway_info'. This is done through specific validators for
internal/external port create/update.

UpgradeImpact:
   Port creation and update does not work with the
  --device_owner='network:router_gateway' option.
DocImpact:
  This new restriction to the port create/update operation
  should be updated in the API docs and CLI command manuals.
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I22a5ee1b17f37130bed35d6d4a25dfa1186c11da
Closes-Bug: #1430345

Adds cascading delete flag for LBaaSv2

This patch adds the "--cascade" flag for the
"lbaas-loadbalancer-delete" command
to support the cascading delete of a load balancer

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-24 14:52:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/base_type_tunnel.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_tunnel.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': "sync_allocations throws DBDuplicatedEntry with postgres HA

When using Galera and two (or more) processes tries to modify
the same records we get a deadlock exception.
Postgres in HA behaves differently, the process that commits
first sees no error, the others get a DBDuplicatedEntry
exception. As already done in Galera case, the solution is to
retry. The transaction will be restarted, the process will get
fresh data and won't try to insert the duplicated entries
anymore.

Change-Id: I7e257f6f2d1db3103e74170b865b184033b495dd
Closes-bug: #1421626
"}]
commit_message:
sync_allocations throws DBDuplicatedEntry with postgres HA

When using Galera and two (or more) processes tries to modify
the same records we get a deadlock exception.
Postgres in HA behaves differently, the process that commits
first sees no error, the others get a DBDuplicatedEntry
exception. As already done in Galera case, the solution is to
retry. The transaction will be restarted, the process will get
fresh data and won't try to insert the duplicated entries
anymore.

Change-Id: I7e257f6f2d1db3103e74170b865b184033b495dd
Closes-bug: #1421626

commit_message:
Prevent created multiple gateway ports on same router's gateway

It is supported by "_lock_router" [1]
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transections
performing concurrently: Two transections will be conflicted because
they update the same row. One transection will be refused

This change adds the "router_hash" attribute in "routers" table

[1] neutron.db.l3_db

Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang <HoangCX@vn.fujitsu.com>

Closes-Bug: #1535225

Change-Id: I8fad90a93618b4434827974d0f87a4ff882108c0

When multiple api and rpc workers enabled for neutron-server,

Instead of agent depending on l2pop driver to notify when to create
or delete flood flows to other agents, let agent decide this on their
own. With this change ovs agent will maintain list of ports on "other
agent" for "each network", like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,
l2pop driver has to notify "only current port fdb" to all agents(only
fanout and no cast notification).In this new appraoch, new field 'port'
added to fdb_entries,because l2pop will always notify about a single
port and can avoid duplicate entries in port's fdb.

from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.Once this obsolete code is removed, l2pop driver
will be simpler like in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302325/

Need to implement similar changes on linux bridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a
'}]
commit_message:
[l2pop] fix agents failing to create flood flows

When multiple api and rpc workers enabled for neutron-server,
sometimes ovs agents fail to create/remove flood flows to other ovs
agents(as l2pop driver is failing to identify first/last port).
Please see bug report for complete description.

Instead of agent depending on l2pop driver to notify when to create
or delete flood flows to other agents, let agent decide this on their
own. With this change ovs agent will maintain list of ports on "other
agent" for "each network", like below,
lvm.tun_ofports={<agent1>: [<port1_id>, <port20_id>, ..],
                 <agent2>: [<port12_id>, <port4_id>, ..]}

For first port on the list, it creates flood flow to that agent.
When list becomes empty, it deletes flood flow to that agent.

With this approach, when a port create/update/delete happens,
l2pop driver has to notify "only current port fdb" to all agents(only
fanout and no cast notification).In this new appraoch, new field 'port'
added to fdb_entries,because l2pop will always notify about a single
port and can avoid duplicate entries in port's fdb.

A new RPC added for agent to get existing network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list and flood entries to other agents
when first port on network(new lvm) on this local agent created(
same happens on agent restarts).

To maintain backword compatility with agents from previous releases,
l2pop driver still notifies about network ports to agent and also
all fdb fields retained.Once this obsolete code is removed, l2pop driver
will be simpler like in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302325/

Need to implement similar changes on linux bridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I6d9d14763c3d4426815fd309a2c80eb8fabd191a

commit_message:
WIP: Make API errors conform to API-WG schema

Just a skeleton for implementing this feature is to help
reviewers understand it easily.

In the patch, only the following 4 aspects are involved.
1. Introduce BaseExceptionMeta into neutron
2. Introduce a wrapper into neutron
3. Enhance wsgi interface to handle Neutron-Common-Error-Format
4. Add wrapper for some APIs (e.g. show())

Change-Id: I41700500b7030a9a5d2e1f0c5f183dba14ef14b3
Depends-On: I996ea1bf1f95548f5fbd7bba19e42e620efd9f67
Co-Authored-By: caosf <caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
Related-Bug: #1554869

commit_message:
Check gateway ip when adding router interface on external network

When user setting gateway for a router, need attach to an external
network. Meanwhile user can add a router interface on that external
network, that cause gateway ip conflict in router namespace.

This patch checks gateway ip conflict when adding a router interface
(add by subnet) on an external network.(In some vendor implementation)
Also prohibits adding a router interface on an external network.
(for Neutron native implementation)

Change-Id: Ieda07e3bc04e7337c2e2aad750798d52347dab1b
Closes-Bug: #1539444

commit_message:
Do not use stevedore namespase as a prefix for class FQNs

Now FQNs of classes are defined only by entry point names.
For backward compatibility it is still possible to find a class
by name with the io.murano.extensions prefix.

bp plugin-fqn-rename

Change-Id: Id63e58ae7a8ed43611a163f22c4de8dc33312afe

commit_message:
Constrain exception handling in _validate_subnet

Constraining exception handling to the netaddr call in
neutron.api.v2.attributes._validate_subnet prevents exceptions that
may occur on unrelated lines from being unintentionally handled.

Closes-Bug: 1510149

Change-Id: I8678be4d1b7ed7361883c62f4f2008f76a7615c0

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 6876, 'name': 'stephen-ma', 'email': 'stephenbma43@gmail.com', 'username': 'stephen-ma'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 9237, 'name': 'Kevin Fox', 'email': 'kevin@efox.cc', 'username': 'kfox1111'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11159, 'name': 'Hong Hui Xiao', 'email': 'honghui_xiao@yeah.net', 'username': 'HongHuiXiao'}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-28 20:46:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Fix issue of SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip

With current code, there are 2 issues.

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be
cleaned, when restarting the l3 agent. Without this rule, the fixed
ip will be SNATed to floating ip, even if the network request is to
an internal IP.

2) The prevent snat rule will not be cleaned, even if the external
device(rfp device) is deleted. So, when the floating ips are removed
from DVR router, there are still dump rules in iptables. Restarting
the l3 agent can clean these dump rules.

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the
same step to handle nat rules for other routers(legacy router, dvr
edge router)

After the change in [1], the fip nat rules for external port have
been extracted together into a method. Add all rules in that method
in the same step can fix the issue of ping floating ip, but reply
with fixed ip.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286392/

Change-Id: I018232c03f5df2237a11b48ac877793d1cb5c1bf
Closes-Bug: #1549311
Related-Bug: #1462154
(cherry picked from commit 1cea77b0aafbada6cad89a6fe0f5450004aef4e1)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix issue of SNAT rule for DVR with floating ip

With current code, there are 2 issues.

1) The prevent snat rule that is added for floating ip will be
cleaned, when restarting the l3 agent. Without this rule, the fixed
ip will be SNATed to floating ip, even if the network request is to
an internal IP.

2) The prevent snat rule will not be cleaned, even if the external
device(rfp device) is deleted. So, when the floating ips are removed
from DVR router, there are still dump rules in iptables. Restarting
the l3 agent can clean these dump rules.

The fix in this patch will handle DVR floating ip nat rules at the
same step to handle nat rules for other routers(legacy router, dvr
edge router)

After the change in [1], the fip nat rules for external port have
been extracted together into a method. Add all rules in that method
in the same step can fix the issue of ping floating ip, but reply
with fixed ip.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286392/

Change-Id: I018232c03f5df2237a11b48ac877793d1cb5c1bf
Closes-Bug: #1549311
Related-Bug: #1462154
(cherry picked from commit 1cea77b0aafbada6cad89a6fe0f5450004aef4e1)

commit_message:
Prevent KeyError exception when port is missing subnet

This changes tries to avoid stacktraces in logs when
ports is missing subnet, e.g.:

  File "neutron/common/utils.py", line 371, in call
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py", line 946, in process_delete
    self._process_internal_ports(agent.pd)
  File "neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py", line 493, in _process_internal_ports
    for subnet in p['subnets']:
KeyError: 'subnets'

Change-Id: I4048f4ed846ac10ecac31c009e2c7fa281a273e9

commit_message:
setup colorized logging for fullstack tests

This change sets log formatting options for colorizing log
output for neutron logs.

SafeConfigParser is replaced with RawConfigParser to avoid
interpolation errors while parsing the config.

Change-Id: I84701dab4106c9b7d3271a501e87cdfa1b2db61c

commit_message:
Remove the default value of target_tenant in RBAC

Using the default value "None" of the target_tenant to create a
RBAC causes an internal server error. This should be removed.

Change-Id: I7823291dfc15d7d8189e4f05108ac892cb94935c
Related-Bug: #1578997

Add target_tenant as mandatory in RBAC creation

to change the target_tenant into a mandatory argument when
creating RBAC.

commit_message:
[l2pop] Remove obsolete code from l2pop driver

In the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/291674/ logic to
add/remove flood entries is removed from l2pop driver and implemented
in agent. Still it maintains the redundant obsolete code for backward
compatibility with agents from previous releases. Once all agents are
moved to this approach, then this patch removes the redundant obsolete
code.

Change-Id: I96f20a75efdaa786ca06eb1ecabc210fdfe9aa21

This change prevents two identical rules when performing concurrent
rule security group creations on same security group

It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transactions

commit_message:
Preventing duplicated rule on *one* security group in neutron active-active

This change prevents two identical rules when performing concurrent
rule security group creations on same security group
in neutron active-active. It is supported by _lock_security_group [1].
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transactions
performing concurrently: Two transactions will conflict each other
because they update the same row to the db will discard the last transaction
and Controller.create[2] will catch and retry the "discarded" allocation.

This change adds the "hash" attribute in "securitygroups" table
to enable previous update.

[1] neutron.db.securitygroups_db
[2] neutron.api.v2.base

Change-Id: I729b626560da821c7f5212014b73352925c8fe3a
Closes-Bug: #1532696

commit_message:
Prevent duplicated CIDRs on *one* Router

This patch set modified to prevent:
1. Duplicated CIDRs could be added to one router
2. Multiple ports which have duplicated CIDRs are added as
one router's interface

It is supported by "_lock_router" [1]
It uses the updating feature of database to disallow 2 transections
performing concurrently: Two transections will be conflicted because
they update the same row. One transection will be refused

This change adds the "router_hash" attribute in "routers" table

[1] neutron.db.l3_db

Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang  <HoangCX@vn.fujitsu.com>

Closes-Bug: #1535226
Closes-Bug: #1535549

Change-Id: I41c2006152016bb2610d5e34ae2a73225463641c

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-17 03:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/firewall.py', 'neutron/agent/firewall.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Fix Open vSwitch Firewall antispoofing rules

This patch addresses a number of short comings in the Open vSwitch
firewall implementation.

Validate source MAC and IP on DHCP discovery messages.

Restrict ICMPv6 traffic permitted by fixed rules to just that traffic
required to perform duplicate address detection, rather than
ICMPV6_ALLOWED_TYPES which defines traffic which should be permitted
ingress to an instance. This includes permitting MLD (Multicast Listener
Discovery) report messages for both versions 1 and 2 of the MLD
protocol.

Validate the source MAC address of this ICMPv6 traffic.

Move ICMPV6_ALLOWED_UNSPEC_ADDR_TYPES into agent firewall module with
FirewallDriver base class so it can be used by both the IPtables
firewall and the OVS firewall implementations.

Change-Id: Ia1f9d768004871d743d2c7b979de1439667efe52
Closes-Bug: 1502933
Closes-Bug: 1558658
Closes-Bug: 1575225
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Fix Open vSwitch Firewall antispoofing rules

This patch addresses a number of short comings in the Open vSwitch
firewall implementation.

Validate source MAC and IP on DHCP discovery messages.

Restrict ICMPv6 traffic permitted by fixed rules to just that traffic
required to perform duplicate address detection, rather than
ICMPV6_ALLOWED_TYPES which defines traffic which should be permitted
ingress to an instance. This includes permitting MLD (Multicast Listener
Discovery) report messages for both versions 1 and 2 of the MLD
protocol.

Validate the source MAC address of this ICMPv6 traffic.

Move ICMPV6_ALLOWED_UNSPEC_ADDR_TYPES into agent firewall module with
FirewallDriver base class so it can be used by both the IPtables
firewall and the OVS firewall implementations.

Change-Id: Ia1f9d768004871d743d2c7b979de1439667efe52
Closes-Bug: 1502933
Closes-Bug: 1558658
Closes-Bug: 1575225

commit_message:
tempest: introduce a decorator to tag all test cases in a class

Tagging every single method in a 'negative' class with a 'negative' tag
is error prone and wasteful. Instead, introduce a decorator that would
mark all test cases of a test class with a set of tags.

Change-Id: I6f310313fdf5e2953d073090f7e06b7c0743eedf

commit_message:
Make HA_VRRP_PRIORITY configurable

HA_VRRP_PRIORITY currently is set to 50 as hardcode, and it's not
configurable.

The patch provides a approach to make one special network node
act as master(or slave) by configuring initial priority.

DocImpact: a previously unused configuration value
           ha_vrrp_priority is now used to configure default
           priority of vrrp(managed by keepalived).

Change-Id: I22c14bd2080bf91959b32be253868952cc2a6801
Closes-Bug: #1571448

The IPSec driver code loops through all routers looking for SNAT

the SNAT namespace for a particular router, an AttributeException
is generated causing the current driver operation to terminate.

This patch makes use of the router.get_valid_snat_namespace_name()

commit_message:
Correctly handle non-SNAT DVR nodes

The IPSec driver code loops through all routers looking for SNAT
namespaces for DVR routers.  On the network nodes that are not hosting
the SNAT namespace for a particular router, an AttributeException
is generated causing the current driver operation to terminate.

This patch makes use of the router.get_valid_snat_namespace_name()
call to ensure it is operating on the correct node.

Change-Id: I8ca95526f50d8fbbbce84e4096f73271d0b88397
Depends-On: I09fadb745cb7ca1b073920b82185ab6dc90dccfc
Closes-Bug: 1481329

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-05 15:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py'], 'message': 'Set global_defs in keepalived.conf

By default keepalived uses "admin@$HOSTNAME" and "$HOSTNAME" for
"notification_email_from" and "router_id" respectively, this works for
most of the environments, but when the machine cannot resolve the
hostname via /etc/hosts nor the configured DNS, the master keepalived
process will get blocked until the dns lookup times out and the backup
will promote itself to master, so both processes will have configured
the same floating IPs.

To prevent this problem router_id is set to 'neutron and
notification_email_from is set to 'neutron@openstack.dummy', this avoids
extra DNS requests while the configuration is reloaded.

Change-Id: I43d4f5d23c43e0603805899e565fb77745745497
Closes-Bug: #1511722
'}]
commit_message:
Set global_defs in keepalived.conf

By default keepalived uses "admin@$HOSTNAME" and "$HOSTNAME" for
"notification_email_from" and "router_id" respectively, this works for
most of the environments, but when the machine cannot resolve the
hostname via /etc/hosts nor the configured DNS, the master keepalived
process will get blocked until the dns lookup times out and the backup
will promote itself to master, so both processes will have configured
the same floating IPs.

To prevent this problem router_id is set to 'neutron and
notification_email_from is set to 'neutron@openstack.dummy', this avoids
extra DNS requests while the configuration is reloaded.

Change-Id: I43d4f5d23c43e0603805899e565fb77745745497
Closes-Bug: #1511722

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-24 11:46:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/utils.py'], 'message': "Display stdout/stderr for execute when debug=True

There are times when something fails when log_fail_as_error or
check_exit_code is not set, particularly ovs_lib ovs-vsctl calls,
and even when debug=True, you'd only get the exit code in the logs
to try to deduce what happened. We already have the data, so there
is no real reason not to display it when debug=True.

Change-Id: I07a1b97399adfc52b4f19795faf56349ba70bdff
"}]
commit_message:
Display stdout/stderr for execute when debug=True

There are times when something fails when log_fail_as_error or
check_exit_code is not set, particularly ovs_lib ovs-vsctl calls,
and even when debug=True, you'd only get the exit code in the logs
to try to deduce what happened. We already have the data, so there
is no real reason not to display it when debug=True.

Change-Id: I07a1b97399adfc52b4f19795faf56349ba70bdff

Don't call create_port inside of a transaction for the
floating IPs backend port. It's incompatible with ML2's
transaction model and may lead to inconsistencies on failures.
See the partial bug for more details.

This makes an attempt to cleanup the port if there is a failure,
but there is a chance the port will be committed and the server
will die or fail to clean it up on a failure. At this point the
admin will need to manually delete the port.

Change-Id: Id7df049602d9c3de55de5a133fb6cad280a85030
Partial-Bug: #1540844
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create floating IP port in transaction

Don't call create_port inside of a transaction for the
floating IPs backend port. It's incompatible with ML2's
transaction model and may lead to inconsistencies on failures.
See the partial bug for more details.

This makes an attempt to cleanup the port if there is a failure,
but there is a chance the port will be committed and the server
will die or fail to clean it up on a failure. At this point the
admin will need to manually delete the port.

Change-Id: Id7df049602d9c3de55de5a133fb6cad280a85030
Partial-Bug: #1540844

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Introduce <...>/health path into APIv2

This commit introduces /v2/collection/health and
/v2/collection/resource/health paths into APIv2, and for such
collections/resources that have registered health checks it calls health
check plugin.

This implementation is fairly easy and not too much effort has been put
into it yet. It is there to enable easy testing of the health service
plugin. There are definitely better ways to achieve this functionality.
Any insights on what way of implementation would be the best to achieve
this goal would be appreciated.

For this set of related commits, the "ping" check would be available by
invoking the following commands:

 $ openstack token issue
 $ TOKEN=[... ID from the command above ...]
 $ PORT_ID=[... ID of one of the DHCP/router ports ...]
 $ curl -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
        -d '{"ping": {"target": "10.0.0.20"} }' -X POST \
        "http://localhost:9696/v2.0/ports/$PORT_ID/health"

Change-Id: Id94215cb57f2350275603ce5fbd15f9ab3803e6e

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Enable L3/DHCP agent health checking

This commit adds health checking capabilities to L3 and DHCP agents. It
does not provide any health check implementation yet, this is left to a
separate commit.

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-05-30 07:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/db.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "HA: notify l2pop on port status update in slave

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255237/ sets up flood flows
between slave agents and other agents.

L2pop driver is not notified about port status changes in slave agents,
because of this in the following scenarios, flood flows in slave nodes
are not created.
1)When l2 agent in slave node is restarted, existing flood flows in
  slave nodes are deleted and not setup again.
2) When existing HA router is added to new slave agent, the new slave
   agent also can't create flood flows to other agents.
3) When HA router is removed from slave agent, other agents are not
   informed about this removal.
Please see [1] and [2] in bug for complete description of the problem.

This change allows plugin to notify l2pop driver when update_device_up
or update_device_down is called by any HA node.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/4
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/3

Closes-bug: #1522980
Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706
"}]
commit_message:
HA: notify l2pop on port status update in slave

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/255237/ sets up flood flows
between slave agents and other agents.

L2pop driver is not notified about port status changes in slave agents,
because of this in the following scenarios, flood flows in slave nodes
are not created.
1)When l2 agent in slave node is restarted, existing flood flows in
  slave nodes are deleted and not setup again.
2) When existing HA router is added to new slave agent, the new slave
   agent also can't create flood flows to other agents.
3) When HA router is removed from slave agent, other agents are not
   informed about this removal.
Please see [1] and [2] in bug for complete description of the problem.

This change allows plugin to notify l2pop driver when update_device_up
or update_device_down is called by any HA node.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/4
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1522980/comments/3

Closes-bug: #1522980
Change-Id: I7207a9fd1bf7aa4a310035371430e4c8ca5d1706

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-31 07:59:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'ml2: ovs: apply ACCEPT rules to unfiltered ports

Unfiltered ports (i.e. port_security_enabled set to False) were excluded
from the list of added ports, which meant the security group logic was
never called on them, so no firewall rules were added for those ports.

That's a problem if the default policy for the FORWARD or INPUT chains
on the compute node is to drop packets, because those ports will end up
having all of their traffic dropped in that case.

This commit ensures that the security group logic is applied to
unfiltered ports, which already includes code that adds the relevant
accept rules:

  -A neutron-openvswi-FORWARD -m physdev --physdev-out tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT
  -A neutron-openvswi-FORWARD -m physdev --physdev-in tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT
  -A neutron-openvswi-INPUT -m physdev --physdev-in tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT

Change-Id: I9e4fa6818e4f296bee9da556e011cd70a689141a
'}]
commit_message:
ml2: ovs: apply ACCEPT rules to unfiltered ports

Unfiltered ports (i.e. port_security_enabled set to False) were excluded
from the list of added ports, which meant the security group logic was
never called on them, so no firewall rules were added for those ports.

That's a problem if the default policy for the FORWARD or INPUT chains
on the compute node is to drop packets, because those ports will end up
having all of their traffic dropped in that case.

This commit ensures that the security group logic is applied to
unfiltered ports, which already includes code that adds the relevant
accept rules:

  -A neutron-openvswi-FORWARD -m physdev --physdev-out tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT
  -A neutron-openvswi-FORWARD -m physdev --physdev-in tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT
  -A neutron-openvswi-INPUT -m physdev --physdev-in tapc51048bd-9f
    --physdev-is-bridged -m comment --comment "Accept all packets when
    port security is disabled." -j ACCEPT

Change-Id: I9e4fa6818e4f296bee9da556e011cd70a689141a

commit_message:
Make API errors conform to API-WG schema

A common API error format [1] has been recommended by API-WG,
which will bring more detailed information about the errors
to help developers and users to find the root reasons easily.

This spec tries to make the neutron API conform to the common
error format.

DocImpact
APIImpact

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

Change-Id: I996ea1bf1f95548f5fbd7bba19e42e620efd9f67
Co-Authored-By: caosf <caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
Partial-Bug: #1554869

This change implements arp_responder on integration bridge rather than
on tunneling bridge. It uses port_update and port_delete notifications
to update arp entries for ports, instead of l2_pop.
The advantages of this approach are -
1) arp_responder can be enabled without l2pop driver
2) support arp_responder for all network types(vlans, vxlan, etc)
   arp_responder based on l2pop is supported for only overlay networks.
3) arp for distributed ports(DVR and HA). This is not supported in
   l2pop based arp_responder.
4) arp packets for local ports(ports connected to same br-int)resolved
   in br-int without broadcasting to actual ports connected to br-int.

This change will be only enabled with a new config
'arp_responder_on_integration_bridge'. It doesn't use 'arp_responder'
 config. There is no dependency between these two approaches.
Users can still use l2pop based arp_responder on tunnel bridge with
'arp_responder' config(And users can enable both, but then arp_responder
will be present on both on br-int and br-tun).

Like l2pop, arp entries for network ports will be added only if the
network is added to host. When a port is added to a host on a network,
and if that is first port on the host on that network, with a new RPC
"get_ports_by_network", host gets all ports belonging to that network
and add arp entries for them.

When ARP spoofing is enabled, ARP will be resolved after spoofing i.e
after ARP spoofing is success, then packet is resubmitted to
ARP_RESPONDER table. When ARP spoofing is disbaled, ARP packets will be
resubmitted from table 0 to ARP_RESPONDER table. When no ARP entry
matches in ARP_RESPONDER table, packet will be flooded through NORMAL
action in integration bridge.

flows with arp responder and arp spoofing on br-int(i.e
ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int).

commit_message:
setup arp_responder on integration bridge

This change implements arp_responder on integration bridge rather than
on tunneling bridge. It uses port_update and port_delete notifications
to update arp entries for ports, instead of l2_pop.
The advantages of this approach are -
1) arp_responder can be enabled without l2pop driver
2) support arp_responder for all network types(vlans, vxlan, etc)
   arp_responder based on l2pop is supported for only overlay networks.
3) arp for distributed ports(DVR and HA). This is not supported in
   l2pop based arp_responder.
4) arp packets for local ports(ports connected to same br-int)resolved
   in br-int without broadcasting to actual ports connected to br-int.

This change will be only enabled with a new config
'arp_responder_on_integration_bridge'. It doesn't use 'arp_responder'
 config. There is no dependency between these two approaches.
Users can still use l2pop based arp_responder on tunnel bridge with
'arp_responder' config(And users can enable both, but then arp_responder
will be present on both on br-int and br-tun).

Like l2pop, arp entries for network ports will be added only if the
network is added to host. When a port is added to a host on a network,
and if that is first port on the host on that network, with a new RPC
"get_ports_by_network", host gets all ports belonging to that network
and add arp entries for them.

When ARP spoofing is enabled, ARP will be resolved after spoofing i.e
after ARP spoofing is success, then packet is resubmitted to
ARP_RESPONDER table. When ARP spoofing is disbaled, ARP packets will be
resubmitted from table 0 to ARP_RESPONDER table. When no ARP entry
matches in ARP_RESPONDER table, packet will be flooded through NORMAL
action in integration bridge.

flows with arp responder and arp spoofing on br-int(i.e
ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int).
(note: some unnecessary fields removed for readability)

commit_message:
Restrict using provider subnet as router interface

When a subnet which belong to a provider network is
added as router interface, it interfers with the actual physical
network gateway of the provider.

With this patch, we add a validation to ensure that if the network
has its physical_network attribute set then we dont allow it to be
added as a router interface.

Change-Id: I74cff1056d02496ea65b3fc5f5f9044c74cb6eb9
Closes-bug: #1556074

commit_message:
Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Linux bridge is not handling RuntimeError exception when it is trying
to delete network's bridge, which is deleted in parallel by nova.
Fullstack test has similar scenario, it creates network's bridge for
agent and deletes the bridge after the test, like nova.

Linux bridge agent has to ignore RuntimeError exception if the bridge
doesn't exist.

Closes-bug: #1561040
(cherry picked from commit 16b2ffdfd85eece8fb57a98d10bf35ad617d235a)

Change-Id: I8451a1dbe25dcda5e9072b60e4329da5fd319433

subject: Do not delete dhcp port when purge tenant's resource
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-07 03:23:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/purge.py', 'neutronclient/tests/functional/core/test_purge.py'], 'message': "Do not delete dhcp port when purge tenant's resource

The original purge logic will delete all ports which are owned by
specified tenant. So it will delete the dhcp port, it will cause new port
can not get ip addr during rebuilding dhcp port, and the new dhcp port's
tenant is still the same as network's tenant. dhcp port will be deleted
through net-delete or subnet-delete. So we should ignore this unnecessary
and risky operation when purge.

This patch ignore the device_owner is 'network:dhcp'. Purge operation
won't delete dhcp port.

Closes-Bug: #1566656
Change-Id: I6b0b9ef869033ae77c81052d74affa97c267813d
"}]
commit_message:
Do not delete dhcp port when purge tenant's resource

The original purge logic will delete all ports which are owned by
specified tenant. So it will delete the dhcp port, it will cause new port
can not get ip addr during rebuilding dhcp port, and the new dhcp port's
tenant is still the same as network's tenant. dhcp port will be deleted
through net-delete or subnet-delete. So we should ignore this unnecessary
and risky operation when purge.

This patch ignore the device_owner is 'network:dhcp'. Purge operation
won't delete dhcp port.

Closes-Bug: #1566656
Change-Id: I6b0b9ef869033ae77c81052d74affa97c267813d

subject: Fix swift ring distribute
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-01 16:33:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/swift_rings_distribute.yml'], 'message': 'Fix swift ring distribute

The swift ring distribute task was using the Synchronize module
which is broken in ansible 2.1 when using become and delegate_to.
The become and delegate_to methods are required to make the module
pull from a remote source to another remote source using a specific
user. To resolve the issue these tasks have been changed to use the
command module.

Related-Issue: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15405

Change-Id: I1f0a14759408e3efd066a8adf4510db688d01437
Closes-bug: #1597475
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift ring distribute

The swift ring distribute task was using the Synchronize module
which is broken in ansible 2.1 when using become and delegate_to.
The become and delegate_to methods are required to make the module
pull from a remote source to another remote source using a specific
user. To resolve the issue these tasks have been changed to use the
command module.

Related-Issue: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/15405

Change-Id: I1f0a14759408e3efd066a8adf4510db688d01437
Closes-bug: #1597475
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-11 13:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['images/sfc-example.png', 'images/sfc-arch.png', 'images/sfc-model.png', 'specs/newton/ietf-compliant-sfc-api.rst'], 'message': 'Neutron IETF Service Function Chaining API

The ability to dynamically instantiate Service Function Chains (SFCs) is
sought by many. Doing so with OpenStack via Neutron brings additional
value since basic networking is already handled and a framework is in
place for translating network abstractions to back-ends such as
virtual switches and SDN controllers. With that in mind, only additional
logic for traffic classification and steering, plus an API capable of
reflecting these capabilities, needs to be added to make Neutron the single

with the pure networking abstraction.

Partial-Bug: #1572656

commit_message:
Neutron IETF Service Function Chaining API

The ability to dynamically instantiate Service Function Chains (SFCs) is
sought by many. Doing so with OpenStack via Neutron brings additional
value since basic networking is already handled and a framework is in
place for translating network abstractions to back-ends such as
virtual switches and SDN controllers. With that in mind, only additional
logic for traffic classification and steering, plus an API capable of
reflecting these capabilities, needs to be added to make Neutron the single
API necessary to instantiate and manage Service Function Chains together
with the pure networking abstraction.

Change-Id: I7c6661c5447f92437f22002abad04f6105eeec79
Partial-Bug: #1572656

commit_message:
Enhance L3Scheduler for active HA router

Currently, the "active" instance of a HA router is determined randomly
by keepalived process.

The spec proposes to enhance L3Scheduler to let neutron select a l3 agent
to host the "active" instance of a HA router.

Co-Authored-By: gongysh <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I36955dd1eac994a2ed9897122ce71beba7758fbf
Implements: blueprint select-active-l3-agent
Partial-Bug: #1370033

subject: Add linux-image-extra-virtual to host packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-29 19:55:04.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': 'Add linux-image-extra-virtual to host packages

It appears that some Ubuntu 14.04 images only contain the base kernel package
and leave out the extra drivers package, linux-image-extra-$(uname -r).
If this package is not installed, openstack-ansible playbooks will fail on
modprobing kernel modules that are not installed (i.e. vhost_net.ko).
linux-image-extra-virtual should provide the linux-image-extra package for
currently installed base kernel package.

Change-Id: If2f008357117495c9e4b80dbfef68503fa93a809
Closes-Bug: 1595323
'}]
commit_message:
Add linux-image-extra-virtual to host packages

It appears that some Ubuntu 14.04 images only contain the base kernel package
and leave out the extra drivers package, linux-image-extra-$(uname -r).
If this package is not installed, openstack-ansible playbooks will fail on
modprobing kernel modules that are not installed (i.e. vhost_net.ko).
linux-image-extra-virtual should provide the linux-image-extra package for
currently installed base kernel package.

Change-Id: If2f008357117495c9e4b80dbfef68503fa93a809
Closes-Bug: 1595323

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-21 21:19:46.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/mysql-wss'], 'message': 'Stop looking for master once latest seqno found

This change updates how we look for a master by stopping once we have
found a service with the largest seqno. Previously if all servers
had the same seqno then we would return the last server as a master
rather than the first. This had the side effect that during bootstrap
when the first server was the original master, it would be demoted for
each new server that was added to the group.  This should prevent the
ocf script from shuffling masters if they have the same seqno. We will
always pick the first server rather than the last.

Change-Id: Iacbd2e2ec403985a1ff52880669b1bec62dbbaba
Closes-Bug: #1592401
Related-Bug: #1592819
'}]
commit_message:
Stop looking for master once latest seqno found

This change updates how we look for a master by stopping once we have
found a service with the largest seqno. Previously if all servers
had the same seqno then we would return the last server as a master
rather than the first. This had the side effect that during bootstrap
when the first server was the original master, it would be demoted for
each new server that was added to the group.  This should prevent the
ocf script from shuffling masters if they have the same seqno. We will
always pick the first server rather than the last.

Change-Id: Iacbd2e2ec403985a1ff52880669b1bec62dbbaba
Closes-Bug: #1592401
Related-Bug: #1592819

commit_message:
Leave the default value of min_ttl up to the service

The previous default, 'None', would error out with oslo_config
expecting an integer value.

ERROR designate ConfigFileValueError:
 Value for option min_ttl is not valid:
 invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'None'

Change-Id: I056c7fff1607b6e7b9153ed7df4868900dc5ae44

subject: Update Gemfile to work in gate
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-01 10:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['Gemfile'], 'message': "Update Gemfile to work in gate

Puppet-lint v1.1.0 (the most recent release in the 1.x series) has a
crashing bug, so we were depending on puppet-lint HEAD. On 2016-06-22,
puppet-lint v2.0.0 was released, so puppet-lint HEAD is now in the v2
series. But puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase depends on puppet-lint
v1, so puppet-lint HEAD no longer satisfies our dependencies.

This patch pins the version of puppet-lint to the commit immediately
before the v2.0.0 release, so we get the bug fix and satisfy
puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase's dependencies.

Change-Id: I3eab1b883a3dc5ca5d02d4c71b97507d36d7f349
Closes-bug: #1597849
"}]
commit_message:
Update Gemfile to work in gate

Puppet-lint v1.1.0 (the most recent release in the 1.x series) has a
crashing bug, so we were depending on puppet-lint HEAD. On 2016-06-22,
puppet-lint v2.0.0 was released, so puppet-lint HEAD is now in the v2
series. But puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase depends on puppet-lint
v1, so puppet-lint HEAD no longer satisfies our dependencies.

This patch pins the version of puppet-lint to the commit immediately
before the v2.0.0 release, so we get the bug fix and satisfy
puppet-lint_variable_contains_upcase's dependencies.

Change-Id: I3eab1b883a3dc5ca5d02d4c71b97507d36d7f349
Closes-bug: #1597849

Following two words should not have space.

 X-Auth-Token
But currently these two words have CR within these words,

commit_message:
[doc/api]Remove space within word

Following two words should not have space.
 X-Subject-Token
 X-Auth-Token
But currently these two words have CR within these words,
This causes redundunt spaces.

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/authenticate-v3.html

Change-Id: I3ae39cdaf19b73b5f7750eeb9b01d1447e2ca73a

commit_message:
Revert "Pre-install pip/virtualenv packages"

This reverts commit a85ce75d6bf720cce0101a3cdfa09c90ef1d156e.

Hitting issues on dsvm jobs when removing python-virtualenv and installing it again with pip:

http://logs.openstack.org/35/332435/6/check/gate-ansible-role-cloud-launcher-dsvm-ansible-func-centos-7/d8ef6d6/

Reproduced the issue here:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/525953/

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-06-16 23:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['elements/centos-minimal/environment.d/10-centos-distro-name.bash', 'elements/pip-and-virtualenv/install.d/pip-and-virtualenv-source-install/01-install-pip'], 'message': "Pre-install pip/virtualenv packages

If we're installing pip/virtualenv from source, we need to make sure
we pre-install the packaged versions before the upstream
versions. Otherwise, CI jobs later on that depend on packaged versions
of pip/virtualenv can bring them in and overwrite the upstream
versions we have installed, which leads to a heck of a mess and
usually very confusing failures.

I have also moved in a small hack from system-config:install_puppet.sh
that we found was necessary when using pip versions from upstream.

Note this is not as much of an issue on Debian/Ubuntu, as they keep
their pip packages in a separate place to the system packages, so you
don't have these overwite conflicts as much.

Change-Id: Ib40708c07b939b84661c44df88a5a308fd0c7216
"}]
commit_message:
Pre-install pip/virtualenv packages

If we're installing pip/virtualenv from source, we need to make sure
we pre-install the packaged versions before the upstream
versions. Otherwise, CI jobs later on that depend on packaged versions
of pip/virtualenv can bring them in and overwrite the upstream
versions we have installed, which leads to a heck of a mess and
usually very confusing failures.

I have also moved in a small hack from system-config:install_puppet.sh
that we found was necessary when using pip versions from upstream.

Note this is not as much of an issue on Debian/Ubuntu, as they keep
their pip packages in a separate place to the system packages, so you
don't have these overwite conflicts as much.

Change-Id: Ib40708c07b939b84661c44df88a5a308fd0c7216

subject: Change the data type of scheduler_default_filters to bool if empty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 14:56:45.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/nova/scheduler.pp'], 'message': "Change the data type of scheduler_default_filters to bool if empty

Puppet-nova expects an array of filters or false (boolean) for the
configuration scheduler_default_filters (nova.conf).
If scheduler_default_filters is not set from THT, then a data type
conversion is required, so that the default value is treated as
boolean 'false'.

Change-Id: I17bafbc0b5deb82b2c2b3c74aa994d4fce0a90cc
Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Change the data type of scheduler_default_filters to bool if empty

Puppet-nova expects an array of filters or false (boolean) for the
configuration scheduler_default_filters (nova.conf).
If scheduler_default_filters is not set from THT, then a data type
conversion is required, so that the default value is treated as
boolean 'false'.

Change-Id: I17bafbc0b5deb82b2c2b3c74aa994d4fce0a90cc
Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>

commit_message:
quickstart.sh fails due to missing redhat-rpm-config

On clean systems quickstart.sh may fail on installing pip dependencies
due to missing redhat-rpm-config. This change add redhat-rpm-config to
quickstart.sh in install_deps().

Closes-Bug: 1598573

subject: Return current router if there are no updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 13:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/router_update_fix-83ce3ddc1ffb46fa.yaml', 'shade/tests/functional/test_router.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Return current router if there are no updates

The update_router() method currently returns None if there are
not updates to be applied, but this is a bug as *some* router
dict is expected to be returned (e.g., the os_router Ansible
module expects a router to be returned).

Change-Id: I50912d03bc57250110f26757d23de92cbcf8002c
'}]
commit_message:
Return current router if there are no updates

The update_router() method currently returns None if there are
not updates to be applied, but this is a bug as *some* router
dict is expected to be returned (e.g., the os_router Ansible
module expects a router to be returned).

Change-Id: I50912d03bc57250110f26757d23de92cbcf8002c
